# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/platformdirs/__init__.py
@source-hash: 15303a2c6366e341
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:48Z

## Purpose
Main entry point for the `platformdirs` library, providing cross-platform utilities for determining application-specific directories. Automatically selects the appropriate platform implementation (Windows, macOS, Unix, Android) and exposes convenient functions for accessing various directory types.

## Core Architecture

### Platform Detection & Selection
- `_set_platform_dir_class()` (L23-42): Dynamic platform detection that imports the appropriate implementation based on `sys.platform` and Android environment variables
- `PlatformDirs` (L45): Runtime-determined platform-specific class instance 
- `AppDirs` (L46): Backward compatibility alias for `PlatformDirs`

### Key Dependencies
- `.api.PlatformDirsABC`: Base abstract class defining the interface
- `.version`: Version information exports
- Platform-specific modules: `.windows`, `.macos`, `.unix`, `.android`

## Public API Functions

### Directory Functions (String Returns)
Functions that return directory paths as strings:
- `user_data_dir()` (L49-70): User-specific data directory
- `site_data_dir()` (L73-94): System-wide data directory  
- `user_config_dir()` (L97-118): User configuration directory
- `site_config_dir()` (L121-142): System configuration directory
- `user_cache_dir()` (L145-166): User cache directory
- `site_cache_dir()` (L169-190): System cache directory
- `user_state_dir()` (L193-214): User state directory
- `user_log_dir()` (L217-238): User log directory
- `user_runtime_dir()` (L271-292): User runtime directory
- `site_runtime_dir()` (L295-316): System runtime directory

### Special User Directories (String Returns)
Parameter-free functions for standard user folders:
- `user_documents_dir()` (L241-243): Documents folder
- `user_downloads_dir()` (L246-248): Downloads folder  
- `user_pictures_dir()` (L251-253): Pictures folder
- `user_videos_dir()` (L256-258): Videos folder
- `user_music_dir()` (L261-263): Music folder
- `user_desktop_dir()` (L266-268): Desktop folder

### Path Functions (Path Object Returns)  
Identical functionality to directory functions but return `pathlib.Path` objects:
- `user_data_path()` (L319-340), `site_data_path()` (L343-364)
- `user_config_path()` (L367-388), `site_config_path()` (L391-412)
- `user_cache_path()` (L439-460), `site_cache_path()` (L415-436)
- `user_state_path()` (L463-484), `user_log_path()` (L487-508)
- `user_runtime_path()` (L541-562), `site_runtime_path()` (L565-586)
- Special user path variants (L511-538)

## Function Parameters
Standard parameters across most functions:
- `appname`: Application name for directory namespacing
- `appauthor`: Application author (Windows-specific, can be `False`)
- `version`: Application version for versioned directories
- `roaming`: Windows roaming profile support
- `multipath`: Return multiple paths (Unix-specific)
- `opinion`: Use opinionated paths vs. bare minimum
- `ensure_exists`: Create directory if it doesn't exist

## Implementation Pattern
All functions follow the same pattern: instantiate `PlatformDirs` with parameters and access the corresponding property. This provides a functional interface over the object-oriented platform implementations.

## Exports
Comprehensive `__all__` declaration (L589-627) exports all public functions, classes, and version information for controlled API surface.
